reviews.review: The movie itself is enjoyable to watch. It is a horror movie, but unless your creeped out by blood I would say you'll encounter the same effect as a jump scare. Definitely a lot of gore. The movie itself is shorter.
The overall vibe is too weird. Is this dark comedy? Is this drama? And it's not that fun. Somewhat boring at a lot of times.
Lil campy if you ask me.
I see little reason to watch this more than once. If you’re interested in a cheesy horror flick this is for you. Doesn’t take itself very seriously
Fun time with fun kills, but I wish it followed its own rules and had less drastic plot holes.
purposefully dark comedy. purposefully awkward. purposefully sardonically scripted. purposefully gross ...accidentally missing the mark.

I think this movie was good, and worth the watch. It had issues for sure. It was more of a comedy with a good amount of gore. I think it kept running jokes too long and some really didn't work. But I really did enjoy most of the story. I'm a massive fan of the concept of cursed objects and the idea of how they cause drastic consequences. If you want a dead serious horror movie this is not the one. It's fun if you're into that kind of horror.
Gore fest with some comedic relief.
Pretty boring. Also, what was that storyline with his brother? Unnecessary and just weird. Love two Theo James tho
It's like if Annabelle and Final Destination had a really weird baby.
I heard good things about it and was expecting to like it, but it was awful. Over the top corny. Gore fans may enjoy it most, but the storyline, pacing, and performances were all just off to me.
Una película que vale la pena mirar si estas un sábado aburrido y no hay nada que ver, es entretenida con toques de humor aunque las escenas de muerte gráficas otorgan una experiencia inolvidable
Pretty empty story just a lot of blood and zero emotion deaths. Guess funny af when you re high af
I loved this movie definitely worth a watch if you like horror comedy movies!
It was okay but cliffhanger

wtf bro la gente estalla manin, malo, la vverdad no me pare de la silla y me fui pq mis amigos son mongolicos y dijeron que ya habian pagado la boleta entonces me quede a "verla" con los ojos cerrados, muy buena, pa dormir
Filme é bom, mas as piadas estilo "scary movie" para mim não fizeram sentido.
Literalmente não consegui assistir o filme até a metade, foi uma cólica cinematográfica que não consegui aguentar até o final.
Well done, gory , and interesting. I enjoyed it. Didn't think it was going to be this good. Happy surprise.
This movie is so bad, a whole waste of time
Gloriously gross. Don’t expect a serious horror here; it’s just good, icky fun.
Es una película demaciado aburrida, muertes sin causas y malas muertes. Incluso la película debió haber terminado a las hora para que fuera decente. Tiempo perdido.
Good actors and good acting. But the story is too flat and unengaging. Boring.
Maybe it got better but I couldn't risk wasting my time. Turned it off 30 minutes in.
Worst movie ever!! Don’t waste your time

This was very far from what I expected it to be, but not in a bad way. Perkins has a sense of humor that is just bordering on cringe but manages to stay on the right side of it, and the kills have just enough build-up and pay-off to keep you in your seat for the next one. Too tongue-in-cheek to be scary, but entertaining enough, with fine performances in spite of the paper thin storyline and wholly unsupported twist.
this is trash. WASTE OF TIME
The actors all knew this was a gory B-movie and played their roles perfectly. A “horror” movie doesn’t need to scare you to be good. This is more on the gruesome comedy side of things.
Ehh wasn’t the best but wasn’t the worse it was just a very redundant movie I lost interest halfway through the show definitely could have waited to watch when it was available on streaming platforms
I should have believed the audience reviews. What an incoherent mess!

Realmente tiene un buen inicio, pero poco a poco va perdiendo el ritmo, fuerza y termina estrellándose, volviéndose una película normal pero que no se volvería a ver, realmente es aburrido el acto final, esperaba mucho mas de esta película.
Went into this movie thinking it was a horror movie, I was surprised that it was trying to be a comedy. Some of the kills in the movie are very well done

An entertaining film. It isn't meant to be taken too seriously. The deaths are creative and at times funny. Pacing is overall decent. I haven't read the book the story is adapted from, so I can't draw any comparisons, but as a standalone work of film it was good.
The storyline wasn't thought through, not enough scary factors. Movie was really random with a couple of good jokes.
I was so confused during this movie

Not funny enough, to be a comedy and not scary enough to be a horror movie. The comedy falls flat for me and most of the time felt rather awkward/wierd than funny. The movie has some decent kills to offer but nothing more.
This is the Robbie Williams documentary which was really good made into a movie that is worthless except for the good soundtrack. Watch the documentary and don’t waste your time on this.
a very edgy comedic horror that knows not too take itself too seriously.
If your looking for a good very gory horror, comedy then definitely check it out.
Entertaining, campy death scene and very Steven King
I wasted $20 on this horrible excuse for a movie. Trust me. Don’t do it.
The movie is really good but the horse part almost made me throw up and I paid good money for that popcorn.
The point of this movie should have been about the insane deaths. There are some, but not enough in my opinion.
Is everyone finally ready to admit that King has never been that good, and it’s only been directors like De Palma and Kubrick that have made his entire career?
Amazing movie and story an twists an turns
I was really hoping for just a little bit more from this. The concept is cool and the story works but I wouldn't lose sleep if I'd never watched this
Boring as hell, watching this as an Easter movie was a mistake. It is fast paced and the lighting is dull. The deaths are also unrealistic. A nonsensical mess.
Nice little movie, nothing more. I think Oz Perkins should just stick to what he’s best at. The Blackcoat's Daughter, Longles, Gretel and Hansel; these are great ones.
Super random but i liked it
i feel like i could have waited to watch this on streaming...
It was more of a comedy than actual horror. The plot left a lot to be desired and didnt quite make sense. The climax was not satisfying.
Really liked the idea behind this film. It wasn’t bad but didn’t quite live up to its promise. A lost opportunity perhaps. Still worth a watch!
Another solid film produced by Neon that does not disappoint. A blent of horror and comedy - this film is a gory masterpiece. Although not as creepy of tone as Longlegs - it is a well adapted film.
It was very weird in a good way and kinda funny. Not really scary more of a thriller type of feel. The movie was okay. I give it a 7.5/10. I enjoyed it with my family
Amazing first half and then it becomes "too dumb" satire.
What a total waste of my time and $20. Glad I didn’t go to the movies and see it or I would have been out more cash for a bucket of popcorn and a coke. Then I would have really been mad. Ugh.
Honestly the only good thing about this movie was Theo James.
Was definitely a lot more enjoyable than I thought it would be. I love me some Stephen King. Previews definitely do not do the movie justice. Worth watching.

Definitely worth a watch! It is brilliant at what it does. It's gory, funny, and doesn't leave you feeling weird or depressed afterwards. You purposely don't get too emotionally involved with the characters, lots of funny moments and genuinely so refreshing compared to almost all gross films. Compared to like a Hereditary, oh my god this was so lightweight yet 10x the gore. Only critique would be that the deaths seemed to become a little rushed at the end to get to the brother. And what the hell was the ghost on the horse??? Recommend!
just so pointless. could just be a list of clips of kills and nothing would change. a montage of 3 mins is better than the whole movie
Pretty solid movie. I liked the satire, even if it wasn’t super deep. I get why some people wanted more horror, but honestly, it’s a chill weekend watch if you’ve got nothing else going on.

Weird, uneven tone, bizarrely and clumsily cut together and the 'jokes' are really off and just don't land. There is no charm or likeablilty at all in this film, the acting is sparky in that irritating mid 2010s Marvel way, the characters are unengaging and the plot struggles along joylessly. Can only imagine that the reason it's got the rating it does is because everything else made this decade is so poor.

Don't blame King for this one, he didn't make the film. It's a wasted opportunity, as if Annie Proulx decided to try horror: unpleasant people being unpleasant to each other, but while being blown to smithereens. There are some great set pieces, a couple of Final Destination level kills, but there are no stakes, and no characters you can root for. In the quiet moments, the script tries for drama and pathos, but that only works if the audience cares. If even one character had been likeable, it might have been redeemed. I finished it because it was there while I was doing other things, but there's absolutely no need to watch it twice.
Very fun horror , blood and guts and a good laugh
Such a fun horror comedy romp that only Oz Perkins could make. Smarter and more sensitive than it seems on the surface, and over-the-top in all the right ways. Easily among the best King adaptations.
Pretty good and funny movie although I wish it had more of a plot
It starts meh and gets worse as it goes on. It's not funny, the deaths are ridiculous, and the plot is incredibly dumb. An absolute waste of a good opportunity.

This is everything a horror movie should be. It was just over 90 minutes long (the perfect amount of time for just about every film). It didn’t have an unnecessarily drawn story with a lot of establishing filler scenes. There was a ton of gore and it was hilarious. I loved every second of it.
Decent acting, very silly movie, funny and gory from start to finish.
Basic story, bad characters. All the kills were very ridiculous.
While it starts off mean spirited, it ends up being horrifically funny.

Crap movie born from the mind of a mediocre and overrated horror writer. Stephen king is not a real horror writer his works are not scary. He is just a simpleton pretending to be a horror/thriller master.
Worst movie I’ve ever seen! It’s so bad that I’m actually wasting my time writing a review about it and I don’t write reviews. Complete garbage
No substance to this one at all. It seems the goal is to introduce a constant steam of graphic deaths for shock value. No real storytelling to be found.
It's beyond camp, it's far past dry humor..It's just awful. I wish I had a MIB memory flashy thingy so I could forget ever having seen it. The writing, the script and the effects are just awful.
This was a very fun surprise of a film. Although it completely departed from the original source material, but regardless, it’s one of the most fun movies you will see.
Very disappointing but still had a good time. Kills was the highlight of the film.

An entertaining film that places its director among the best in the genre right now. It offers a fun, bloody, dark, and effective adaptation that entertains without restraint in its 98 minutes. It has its flaws, of course, but its strengths outweigh those weaker moments, and the visual and bloody spectacle create a sweet and rewarding moment on screen with one of the funniest films of 2025 so far.
My honest opinion this movie sucks you’re welcome.

Per me le cose sono due o é un gran film volutamente girato da film schifoso e allora meriterebbe 5 stelle perché è fantastico, o é un film talmente fatto male che uno può pensare che sia voluto ma non é cosi e quindi fa schifo. La storia non sarebbe nemmeno male ( graziealcazzo é di king) per il resto ogni volta che la scimmietta batteva i piatti speravo toccasse a me
Worst movie of the decade, basically wasted 1.5 hrs of my life that won’t get back.. Don’t let “Based on Stephen King’s ” fool ya… ZERO STAR!
Great fun from start to finish. Full of inventive kills and humour, perfect for a Saturday night viewing with a beer and a pizza
It was fine but I had higher expectations just by seeing Stephen King's name on it. I didn't get bored but the ending didn't feel like a proper ending.

I want my twenty bucks back, with penalties and interest. A masterclass of how to screw up a horror movie: make it mishmash of camp, comedy and gore, without any real terror or suspense. Watch the Twilight Zone "Living Doll" with Telly Savalas; it's better!
Está muy buena pero la verdad tanta comedia hacía que se sienta Un poco fuera de lugar Pero igual está buena

Funny and gory, full of creative deaths! Amazing casting for the child and adult versions of Hal and Bill. The film laid the groundwork for a couple of plot-points that it never really followed up on, but beyond that, it was a fun ride.
I swear, films that are distributed by Neon are so underrated. Will people ever realize how solid/good/phenomenal/amazing these films are?? Don’t need to ask me, these films won me over.
Story was fun, and you can really tell they nailed the horror/comedy mix. Sometimes more comedy than horror but still a fun watch.
It’s not funny a lot of the time.
Great movie, lots of gory fun.

This should be classified as a horror comedy because it's funny as hell. A bit more character development could've made this better, but overall it's solid, and the kill scenes are very Final Destination. oh and Theo James in glasses is hot as hell

Saw this movie with a group of friends. A lot of goofy and unlogical deaths happen throughout. Like the pool scene (if you know you know). Wouldn't say its my favorite of the year but its definitely worth the watch!
The movie is good and horrible
Pretty silly and over exaggerated kills, but I assume it was meant that way. It was OK.
Pretty funny and entertaining nonsense

A quirky and somewhat original horror movie with high-quality production value like Longlegs, however different and better than Longlegs imo. It also reminded me of Thanksgiving it had a very artistic and beautiful filming aspect to it. Script wasn't Shakespeare, but funny and insightful even at times. Plot was more interesting than most horror movies, I mean come on the Terrifier movies and many other horror movies barely have a plot. Acting was also pretty good really felt like the two twins were different people. While it has flaws, I'd say this movie is almost great in some ways. I'm going to give this one another watch in a few months.
Dont waste your time or money going to see this garbage. Its basically a longer episode of 1000 ways to die. Trash
While the movie had some unexpected moments and some funny scenes it felt as though it was lacking
It's no Pet Sematary(that's a movie and book that scared the crap outta me when it came out) but it did have a lot of gore and good acting.
Pretty funny, reminds me of final destination kills. Its better than rachel zeglers snow white thats for sure. Adam scott is in it so i mean its not that terrible.
tôi đánh giá phim này điểm cực phê

I enjoy most King movies and novels but could not agree less with his political persuasion anyway I liked this movie although it was kind of a comedy and not very scary. Characters were solid and it was entertaining so I gave it a 4 and recommend it. Would be nice if King could create something truly frightening again like Salems Lot now there is a scary movie!
Not what I was expecting, but all the better for that. Bloody great fun.
There’s loads of crazy kills and chaotic themes and the story is still good
It starts out interesting, then gets boring in the middle
great spend time, i had a lot of fun

This movie is a travesty did the people who made this even read the original story? Stop turning everything Stephen King does into a horror comedy or a joke of a film ie the boogeyman into Stephen King stop selling out your stories to these hack studios it would be a bunch of paid reviewers that give it a decent score like if anyone who is actual Stephen King fan and is read this story this movie looks like a joke of his work and I can't believe he signed off on it
As a horror fan this was not what I wanted but atleast it promises to keep to watching
Would have been better as just a book. Movie was rushed. Love S King though
More like the Midkey
Kill scenes were good and the concept was great!
Thought it was horrible. I walked out after 15 minutes.

"O Macaco" é um filme interessante que brinca com o próprio roteiro, misturando o bizarro e o cômico. Para aproveitar, é bom entrar na proposta de rir do horror. Os personagens, em sua maioria, são bem irritantes, mas o filme funciona. Ah, e a sonoplastia está ótima!
Its a fun way to waste two hours watching people get killed in creative ways. If you go in with that expectation, you wont be disappointed.
that movie sucked. fell asleep 😴 💤 😪
So funny, so dark, and so twisted!!! If you're looking for a great time with a TON of blood and gore, this is the movie for you!!!

It seems like it was directed by a director who has no idea of what they are doing. The acting was so bad , the writing , the dialogues , the pacing , the death scenes , etc .. it's the worst piece of cinema to ever to exist
More funny than scary

Great classic nasty GORE!!! Story was a bit lackluster , but the ominous scenes with the addition of the creepy scary background music got this movie the 3 stars that it received from me . Hopefully part 2 is better .
Pretty funny but not in the realms of Perkins' fully personalised projects.
The film is neither funny nor scary. Indecent joke filled up the movie without any purposes. The plot boring as hell especially worth my rating.
Cool gore, but the script was bad. I know they made the script bad for comedic purposes, but just because it was intentional doesn’t make it funny.

This film was an absolute atrocity. I was in literal shock wondering how on earth this film was this terrible. The fact that it was fully funded, was reviewed by everyone before being released and still everyone said, "Yep, this is it!". Usually films are hit or miss but apparently now a days the chances of a movie being a hit is below 10%. I said F-it, it's Theo James, James Wan & we get Adam Scott and Elijah Wood?! Okay, I'm sure it'll be a good movie or at least decent. BOY WAS I WRONG. Work must be slow right now because WTF WAS THIS??? Please do not waste your money, that was 2 hours of my life I will never get back. I am in disbelief at how movies from the early 2000's easily run circles around movies that come out today. How are producers, writers and directors not embarrassed that the quality of movies today are actually embarrassing??
For me personally - a good movie in style, a good plot, a good atmosphere. I expected less, much less
Surprisingly enjoyable, and the comedy was on point

From the overly ridiculous deaths (woman explodes diving into a pool that is electrified??!) to the slow pace of the film and then finally a "shock" ending that again displays a ridiculous death, boring dialogue and wooden acting.
I actually had fun watching this movie!!!

Is a good movie, worth a watch. If you wanna really enjoy the movie, watch in a Friday night and turn off your brain, dont try to understand the movie. The comedy and gore its really fits the movie style, and also brings some moments really good acid humor moments. The ending of the movie was pretty stupid but most of the movie i likes. Is dont think is so bad how everyone says. If you ARE a squeamish person dont watch this movie.
poor film, boring and stupid.
Filme podre demai, Scam do caralho
I thought it could have used the creativity Stephen King has if he were involved in the making of the movie.
Very entertaining with an impressive amount of dark comedy.
it was like a spin on Final Destination franchise. The twisted comedy on the gruesome deaths was funny not scary.
this movie sucks dont watch it
Literally the worst movie I’ve ever seen. Sad to see Theo James in such a stupid role.
When the trailer came out i couldn't wait to see it & it did not disappoint! I loved it! It's so nice to see different movies instead of the same movies constantly over and over again
It had a couple okay moments but overall it never gripped me. It was a movie that couldn’t decide what it wanted to be
It is a great slapstick horror comedy that keeps it fresh coming from a very thin plot
This movie feels like Goosebumps, except I hoped better for a Stephen King book made into a movie. It's been years since there has been a good film adaptation of one of King's stories. Oh well.
A passable comedy horror that storywise is a little dull but gets by on it's inventive kills.

The comedy is genuinely really funny but then that’s when I noticed that halfway through the movie it became more comedy than horror and not being able to balance it out. While it’s Final Destination like kills are not a new concept it was a nice throwback.
Worse Steven king movie
Yeah this is not very good

Intentionally quirky aura and over-the-top, intentionally unrealistic kills, give this a kind of charm I wasnt expecting. That said, it was enjoyable enough, yes, but it didnt do the job of adding another terror doll to the WanVerse like I hoped it would and especially with it based on a Stephen King short story. A solid, funny watch with plenty of goddamn! kill moments, but not much more than that. Expected wayyyyyy more, but its also not terrible.
Was more of a scary comedy than a real horror movie. It was alright
The movie goes no where and doesn’t explain anything, throughout the movie u see b movie deaths and its just a waste of time
one of the best suspense horror thriller
Not a horror movie IMO‼️ BUT very hilarious and entertaining nonetheless 😂😭

This movie was very funny in a very sick way. It is not for the squeamish. Don't expect a movie that gives you nightmares, unless seeing a woman with her head on fire running around comically and impaling herself on a for sale sign gives you nightmares.

I was looking forward seeing it but..... This is big waste of time. Story.... Awful, gore.... Hardly any and the split second you see someone dying, boring. Maybe if I'm 12yo I would enjoy it. I would not even watch it again if they pay me.
The previews looked like it would be good. The story line was boring, random scenes and a HUGE waste of time. I almost rather watch snow white…. Almost.
My bf “definitely not a good movie, but made me laugh a few times”.
Atuações fracas, efeitos especiais amadores, e mortes extremamente absurdas.

It was a hell of a ride. Horror, comedy, drama and Final Destination level death scenes. Great cast with Theo James (Playing both Hal and Bill), Adam Scott, Elijah Wood & the young and talented Christian Convery (playing both young Hal and young Bill). There's even an appearance from director Oz Perkins himself. I really enjoyed it. Creative death scenes, laugh out loud scenes and just enough humanity to make it all work. If you are not a fan of horror? Stop creating reviews of horror films. Thank you.
If youre looking for a serious scary film, this sure as hell aint it. But damn this movie is HILARIOUS. Would definitely recommend.
Such a wierd movie. Enjoyed it. It’s a dark comedy that I wasn’t expecting. Liked it more than I thought I would. Super strange.
Over the top in every way. Which ended up making it enjoyable but I was desperately hoping it would be scary. It’s literally a comedy that has gore in it.
visual yang mencekam bikin dakdik duk sendiri nontonya
The comedy dark humour is amazing and the stunning gore as well
Exactly as you'd expect.
Love it! I really love horror movies and unexpectedly i love this movie sm!
i like that it doesn't take itself too seriously
-its good and the book
too much hype, very little substance...if any.
no real story just alot of messy kill scenes, my boyfriend fell asleep LOL
Doesn't seem much like a Stephen King movie. I wasn't expecting a dark comedy . Everyone else in the theatre left (in fairness there were only 2 other people) and my husband fell asleep. So.

Way worse than I expected 😝 It didn’t scratch my #horror itch at all - the scares felt weak, and the tension just wasn’t there. That said, the dark comedy was a highlight, and I did enjoy some of the performances 🧐✌️
Great suspense scenes!
Movie lacked details and just a bunch of messy killing , I was very disappointed .
Can’t believe Theo James agreed to be in this movie. Love him, love horror, even comedy horror… this was truly a waste of his talent, not to mention time and money.
Very Good movie, it Kept me jumping out my seat in various scary scene of the movie
Hilarious! Dry dark humour. Clever and witty.. love the actors and the story.
So overrated. So disappointed in this. The bunny from Oddity did a better job.
Ive realized after watching this that I am not a fan of horror/comedy combination movies. Not very scary and not very funny, mostly just gory.
It’s just really goofy but I guess that’s the point
It was good movie but I feel like it couldve had more.
Funny and scary at the same time, recommend watching it.
it was horrible! i did not like it at all waste of money. do not watch it
Não cumpriu o que prometeu. Prometeu ser mau, mas é péssimo.
Strangely boring. Intensely stupid. Genuinely sorry I wasted my time on this.
Movie was better than expected. Tad bit corny but funny while doing it.

Muy entretenida. El director de "Longless" demuestra tener un sentido del humor perverso y un tanto cruel. No recuerdo la novela de Stephen king para saber si tiene ese sentido del humor un tanto retorcido 😂👍
The movie has good special effects and some pretty cool looking scenes, but it feels like the dialogue and plot was written by a 12-year-old.

Eine schwarze Splatter Dramödie im 70s/80s Style. Irgendwo zwischen Harold & Maude und Omen, dem Urvater von Final Destination. Die Geschichte ist recht Simpel und bietet kaum Überraschungen, was nicht unbedingt schlecht ist. Perkins war/ ist sicherlich bewusst, dass bei einem solchen Film die Kills der Star sind und die Geschichte bloss Überbrückung. Das ist nur bei den Omen Filmen anders. Die Kills selbst sind nicht nur unheimlich kreativ, die Tode sind auch völlig überzogen. Körper Explodieren gleich. Irgendwo ist da auch ein Einfluss von Monthy Python zu sehen. Ist der Film zu Beginn noch ambitioniert mit der Geschichte, wird in der zweiten Hälfte der Versuch zurückgenommen und befreit gemeuchelt. Definitiv ein Rabenschwarzer Spass im Arthouse Gewand. Sehenswert
Overall I liked it. But it surprised me. Meaning i didn't expect it to be the kind of movie that it was.
It was ok. Definitely was a bit bland. Could have been scarier and funnier. They added some of Kings touches but still it didn’t deliver for me.
never imagined, quite scary to watch alone
Only thing scary bout this was the dialogue and the pace. Feels like the kind of movie somebody wld write coming off a 12 hour binge on poppers.
Watch it with my man. It was creepy yet kind of funny. We liked it! ❤️
An original concept used to perfection. The movie is entertaining and keeps your attention through the entire film using comedy and keeping the pedal on the horror.
Too cheesy not a scary movie.

I went to go see this movie with my friend and my family and I loved it I was funny and bloody at the same time I will definitely watch it again when it goes on streaming if you love gory movies than this one is for you
Terrible movie, waste of money
I really enjoyed it yesterday I would love to see it again best movie hands down Steven King the goat
Didn’t get to watch movie
Simply put, it’s a bad script. A lot of potential but just some baffling lines and predictable scares. Nice gore moments though.
Is good is like long legs but more scares and blood and good kill
Exceptionally entertaining
Was a new kind of watch. But somewhat too predictable. And kind of all over the place

Let me inform you that I knew it was a dark comedy before I saw it. The movie wasn’t funny or entertaining. Plenty of gore but absolutely nothing scary about it. This makes a lot of B movies look like great films.
It was alright. Didn't make much sense and not as good as Longlegs.
It was really good. Reminds me of Final Destination movie. I guess I expected more gore.
We need something besides horror movies to watch. Please.

Lovely trash movie, made me laugh at lot. The absurde deaths, the stupid brother, the small side jokes hidden in plane sight (for instance on the city sign), the scenery - all fits well. Minus 1 Star as the movie has some long scenes which don't add a lot and I would have loved to instead get some more insights on the kid's dad.
A film that is aware of itself and doesn't apologize at all for it. It continues the ridiculous killing sequences and you always get a feeling of uncertainty of who's gonna die next.

AWESOME! This is what you go to the theaters for. It’s fun, it’s a perfect Friday night out movie. It’s campy gore, over the top awesome kills with a good story and good actors behind it. Don’t overthink it, just go and enjoy the fun.

Absolutely horrible movie. Definitely did not live up to the insidious series of movies. Ridiculous absurd death scenes that were so over the top that it absolutely ruined the film not to mention the over use of the word Goddanit & F
I hope anyone involved in this gets bankrupt .
horrible - pretty stupid
This as a fun movie. It had great laughs and some great gore . It was much better than I expected it to be.
Unfortunate this is a trash movie with trash acting

The movie was alright. I liked the main character. However, the main villain's motives were empty, and the way the movie resolved was stupid. The movie's gore was top notch, and the humor was pretty good. Overall it was good but no great.

Very interesting idea but so many plot holes. It was very old school with random almost humorous kill scenes but at the end of the day didn't deliver the same full circle story scape that Stephen king is known for
Niceeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee

a bit corny, but honestly pretty good. things were pretty fast paced which i really liked. it got straight to the point without dragging on forever. the gore is also pretty crazy. i’d recommend watching!
Good, loved the gore!

My favorite movie of the year so far! There isn't a dull moment, with lots of violence, humor, twists, and turns....I'm a big Steven King fan and this movie holds the short story it's based on in the highest regard. Can't WAIT until I can buy it for home viewing.
No plot. More satire than storytelling.
Humorous horror that had most laughing than scared. A nice twist on the Stephen King novel.

I liked the story line. I liked the way they used the toy and I really liked the fact that it not only made me jump twice but eventually it became, at least to me, a comedy. I began laughing towards the end when all the bodies were exploding. Somehow it struck me as funny.
This movie was buns.
Good movie. Doesn't take itself too seriously and adds a nice layer of comedy by poking fun at itself. it's was a very enjoyable movie.
The kills were funny and weird and the twist was pretty decent. I would probably watch again if i was in a big group on halloween.
Scary fun very funny great film
Total Garbage. Just like longlegs
FANTASTIC comedic dark horror at its finest!
Fun little story about the inevitably of death

I went into this movie expecting a lot of jump scares and dramatic tension. I didn’t realise it was also a comedy. I’m so glad I didn’t know, because knowing would have made it less of a shock and an unexpected delightful surprise. I was alternating between wanting to cover my eyes and laughing my head off. It reminded me of cocaine bear a bit. I’m telling you this because the audience gave it a lower score than the critics did, which is unusual. Normally this happens when the audience gets something they weren’t expecting. Or they don’t get something about it. So trigger warning - if you don’t like extreme gore or VERY dark humour, this is not the movie for you. If you do, you’ll bloody love it. Emphasis on the bloody.

Após o polêmico lançamento de Longlegs, que serviu como porta de entrada para muitos na filmografia de Oz Perkins, o diretor retorna com O Macaco, um filme que flerta com o terror, mas não se decide entre gêneros. Diferente do seu antecessor, este novo projeto se assume como uma obra de terror com toques de comédia, buscando entregar uma experiência híbrida ao espectador. No centro dessa história, Theo James assume o protagonismo, marcando seu papel de maior destaque após sua participação na série Magnatas do Crime. No entanto, mesmo com sua atuação dedicada, o ator não tem muito material para trabalhar, pois seu personagem se perde no meio de um roteiro descompassado e relações humanas mal desenvolvidas. Oz Perkins, conhecido por sua estética peculiar e tentativas de inovação dentro do gênero, arrisca mais uma vez ao experimentar novas abordagens para o terror. No entanto, a falta de equilíbrio entre os gêneros se torna um grande problema. Enquanto Longlegs enganava o espectador ao vender uma proposta de terror puro e entregar algo muito mais introspectivo, O Macaco desde o início não esconde sua mescla com a comédia. O problema é que, ao contrário do que se poderia esperar, essa fusão de tons não funciona de maneira coesa. O terror se perde, restando apenas algumas sequências de mortes bem orquestradas que, embora criativas, não são o suficiente para sustentar o interesse na narrativa. O maior problema do filme é sua inconsistência tonal. Perkins tenta equilibrar o humor e o horror, mas acaba prejudicando a experiência ao não conseguir dosar corretamente esses elementos. O resultado é uma obra que se esforça para parecer inovadora, mas que, na prática, não se decide sobre qual caminho seguir. O roteiro, que já mostrava falhas evidentes em Longlegs, aqui se afunda ainda mais. O que deveria ser um terror original e revigorante se perde em um roteiro que carece de coesão e desenvolvimento de personagens. Além disso, os relacionamentos em O Macaco são tão mal construídos que muitas interações soam artificiais e desinteressantes. Os personagens são unidimensionais e suas dinâmicas carecem de profundidade, tornando difícil qualquer envolvimento emocional do público. Até mesmo os momentos que deveriam gerar impacto emocional se perdem devido a atuações que, embora esforçadas, não encontram respaldo no roteiro. Theo James até tenta adicionar um peso dramático ao seu personagem, mas esbarra nas limitações do material que tem em mãos, entregando uma atuação genérica e esquecível. Nem mesmo a talentosa co-star consegue salvar o filme de seu próprio destino desastroso. No fim, O Macaco sofre para se justificar. O filme não consegue equilibrar o humor e o terror, resultando em uma experiência que não assusta, não diverte e tampouco revoluciona o gênero, como Perkins parece acreditar. Em comparação com Longlegs, percebe-se uma clara regressão técnica: até mesmo a ambientação e a fotografia, pontos que antes se destacavam, aqui parecem apagados. No fim das contas, O Macaco falha ao tentar ser inovador e acaba se tornando um espetáculo de fatalidades criativas que, apesar de estilizadas, não são suficientes para sustentar um filme com uma narrativa tão inconsistente. O que poderia ser um respiro novo para o terror acaba deixando apenas a sensação de desperdício de potencial.

A bag of mixed nuts; a classic King macabre sprinkled with humour and complicated relationships. The story does not fall short of entertaining, however, the casting was disappointing to say the least. Theo James, who played Hal, was far too “Hollywood” for this role. Hal works at a grocery store, he lives alone and keeps the world at a distance. His appearance should reflect this. Lip filler, fake teeth, lusciously groomed. It throws the character off balance completely. Horrible decision. The humour fell short a few times with Colin O’Brien who played Petey. Likely a combination of the writing and acting, but it felt more so due to poor acting skills. Not an entirely a disservice to Stephen King but casting shouldn’t have gone a different way.
there's no reason for this movie to exist but i was entertained start to finish!

Stupidest movie i've ever seen. Pointless, horrible "plot". What a waste of time. I should have walked out to do anything that would have been more productive. This is the worst movie I have ever seen in my life. I respect other people’s opinions and would like to say I understand why someone would have enjoyed this film… but, no. The only reason I stayed until the end is because my husband fell asleep, and who was I to wake him up and subject him to the rest of this nightmare?

É até uma ofensa aos filmes medíocres colocar este na mesma posição. Esse filme não tem contexto de nada, os personagens são mal desenvolvidos e sem direção nenhuma de personalidade. O mau é malvado porque sim, o bom é bom pq é burro. Simplesmente o pior filme que já vi até agora. Ouso dizer que teve alguns poucos momentos que gostei de como foi feito uma cena ou outra, mas ele tinha todas as possibilidades para ser um bom filme e escolheu apenas as erradas.

Totally worthless! Not scary, not funny, bad overall acting, bad script, bad directing. Totally boring up to the end. Especially the way of portraying the dead scenes - via narration while showing short clips of what happened - doesn't work at all and is scary nor funny. During the film multiple people even left the cinema. I went to see this because it had a rating of 79% on this site and thought it was worth a try. I do not understand this high rating. I think it’s fair to say I’m just not really a fan of Osgood Perkin’s style of films. I only kind of liked Longlegs and this was significantly worse. Way too much needless slow dialogue. Weird camera shots and scenes. The way people died was also not at all realistic or possible. Not really scary or compelling.
Very entertaining and new 🔥🔥🔥

It was fun, super campy. curious if the book was more serious, the serious tones of deaths were just gags and laughs. Was the movie suppose to be scary? Modtly just gory, the movie has SOO much potential, the premise is really cool i loved that. I hope to see a more serious version someday..

(SPOILERS!) I think it's worth a watch and for sure has the weird and strange Stephen King parts (Which are some of my favorite things of his books). The acting is great along with the dark comedy inserted into, I found myself giving it a good chuckle. My only problem with the film is the number of kills and sometimes the quality of the kills. In my opinion the greatest kill is the first one we see. After that it doesn't really feel as elaborate or disgusting as the first kill did also most if not all are CGI kills which can be good but sometimes you want practical effects for them. I really wished we got to see all the kills in the final act that were off screen.

This is an absolute blast of a film - absurdist, warm, funny, wildly gory, and gorgeously designed - I'm not sure why it's getting splat reviews except that it's falling prey to the 'horror curse' of mainstream review sites. If you liked any of the original Evil Dead movies you'll like this. If you didn't like Evil Dead (or Cabin In The Woods, or Cabin Fever, or Drag Me to Hell), why did you go see a horror movie?
I enjoyed the hell out of it. I laughed. I thought it was great.
Lo nuevo de Osgood Perkins es una oda a lo absurdo, que se nutre del cine de serie B para crear una sátira entretenida, cargada de gore y sorpresas repetitivas.
A boring, unfunny, poorly paced, bad written, mess of a movie. Avoid.
I expected way more from this movie Unfortunately it was a let down and a little boring

Movies are pretty mean spirited these days. This one is no exception. The attempts at dark comedy are rapid fire, and the freewheeling goofyness of the film is rare in wide release films, which gives a sort of admirability.. . Surprisingly faster paced than “Longlegs” and probably a superior film. Director again uses classic rocks songs to strong effect. The lighting and camera work are all good. Still the film feels kind of hollow and inhuman. No real connection to the characters.

The trailer looked decent but it was definitely not what I was expecting. It wanted to be comedy and a scary movie ? The kills were goofy and the “humor” was very cheesy. Feels like a tubi movie honestly. Do not recommend

It was gory. I thought the story was well written. I love Stephen King. (Theater interruption) There was a couple at the movies who brought their newborn with them. Luckily the dad took the baby outside.
They don't try too hard to scare you and the story flows smoothly.

Wow! A cult classic in the making! Amazingly done so funny and dark with little Easter eggs to find. Like the bowling ball. lol I want to see it again! Let’s learn some quotes and go shout them out! Rocky horror picture show style!

It was absolutely hilarious!

One of the weirdest movies I have ever seen but I did enjoy it and also enjoyed Theo James in it. I can't blame anyone that didn't like it, however. 70/100

A diverting spin on the Final Destination motif. The screenplay isnt going to knock your socks off by any stretch, but there are plenty of jump scares and a healthy amount of gore to keep your heart rate up and your stomach churning. Not a must see, but definitely worth a watch if youre looking for something light and not to cerebral.

Not sure this film knew what it wanted to be. Some funny moments, some gory kills but a bit confused in the end!
The movie was ok lots of cheap kills/thrills. Not very realistic felt like a final destination knock off.
Wasn’t scary or funny, just a confusing and boring movie

That was the hardest I’ve laughed in a theater in a long time. Perkins’s sense of humor is both sick and creative. The carnage was unique and the story, essentially about estranged brothers trying to deal with the sudden death of their mother, was even bizarrely poignant. Not everyone’s taste, for sure, but for strong willed, discerning viewers, it is an absolute must see.
Stupid kind of funny scary movie… kind of predictable but had some good giggles
Loved it- second time seeing it. Theo James is hot
The movie was boring, slow, had absolutely ZERO ability for retention…didn’t care about any of the cast at all. I almost fell asleep twice and contemplated walking out.
